intro: Eriocaulon yunnanense, commonly known as the Yunnan spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, white flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and wet meadows. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered with a fine, hairy texture, contributing to its unique appearance. Its flowering period typically occurs during the spring and early summer months.
